intro: Verbascum thapsoides, commonly known as goatweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it adaptable to various environments. It is often found in disturbed areas, roadsides, and open fields. Verbascum thapsoides is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
